review_title: This comapny is only good as a stepping stone for a real organization
pros: Good people who work with you, paid national holidays, you can do your medical appointments while at work. Besides that, not much else.
cons: Where to begin! Incompetent mid level managers, worse are the corporate staff who suck up most of the funding in their salaries while the rank and file employees work at below living wages. Every year this company gets worse, rapid expansion led to loss of revenue, cut backs on vital programs serving the community, layoffs to cover financial mismanagement. No more bonuses, you have to pay for the employee holiday party and no over time allowed. Most employees are very dissatisfied with overall management and working conditions.

pros: Convenience days and hours of operation. Good place to work and some staff members are friendly. Great place for the uninsured population to obtain access to health care.
cons: Low pay and no opportunities to grow. Benefits are being reduce every year. Poor health insurance for employees. Very tense environment.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Family Medicine in Miami, FL
pros: Some of the pros are the benefits, the amount of holidays, the 9-5 work schedule, and the free health insurance if you see their providers.
cons: The pay is very low for the work load, the supervisors do not always listen to employees, and they at limited with scheduling flexability.

job_title: Patient Financial Representative in Miami, FL
pros: It is really easy work once you learn your job functions. Easy access to medical care
cons: Too many hands in the pot, so to speak. Large level of micromanaging. Move to a new department, expect to get sick.

pros: Convenient location for me to drive home and to work. The company was good to work for.
